intro: Oxybaphus expansus, commonly known as the broadleaf oxybaphus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species adapted to arid environments. The plant features fleshy, lobed leaves that help store water, and it produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and red. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for low-maintenance landscaping.
